item.title: Use Random in C++
item.author: sky_io@outlook.com (K4i)
item.description: Old way use rand(), usually pair with a random initialization of the seed: 1 2 srand(int(time(0))); // initialize the seed rand(); // get a random int, [0, RAND_MAX] get random int in [0,x): rand()%x get random real in [0, 1]: rand()/double(RAND_MAX) Modern way 1 2 3 4 5 // ... #include <random> std::random_device rng; std::mt19937 urng(rng()); random_device random_device is a uniformly-distributed integer random number generator that produces non-deterministic random numbers.
item.dc:creator: Kyle

item.title: cin & cout is slow?
item.author: sky_io@outlook.com (K4i)
